frontmatter.title: Through all this
frontmatter.description: The current challenges will subside, and new problems will arise. Keep moving through this all.

frontmatter.title: Relaxed environments
frontmatter.description: Everybody faces difficulties and challenge each day, and the outside world is often less forgiving than the ideal scenario. Make it easier at home be creating a better environment.

frontmatter.title: Positive narrative
frontmatter.description: The challenges are real and the outcome may be undetermined, and the narrative can still remain positive. Emphasize positivity, find solutions to problems, make it a positive narrative.

frontmatter.title: End of day routines
frontmatter.description: Don't waste the time introducing problems that cannot be solved that day. It it's a worthwhile problem, there will be a better chance to fix it tomorrow.

frontmatter.title: Set clocks
frontmatter.description: Recognize limits, be deliberate and prepare for what comes next. There's always more that could be done and a new time will come. Set clocks to mark time and transition to what's next.

frontmatter.title: Mental schedule prep
frontmatter.description: Set out with right outcomes in mind, recognize the unwavering progression of time.

frontmatter.title: Pathways to open options
frontmatter.description: Find pathways to increase options and grow opportunities. Choosing the _right projects_ is less important than finding something on the path.

frontmatter.title: Appreciate best of others
frontmatter.description: Bring good energy and help others with their struggles. Find ways to appreciate the good from others. Work to be better for others.

frontmatter.title: Adventurous perspective
frontmatter.description: Yvon Choinard says "Adventure begins when everything goes wrong." Another perspective is to approach days and projects as adventures, knowing everything will not go right. The destination is often less important than the adventure, like any good rantum scoot.

frontmatter.title: Expected outputs
frontmatter.description: Recognize the expected outputs from a given effort. Don't expect results that don't match the inputs.

frontmatter.title: about me
frontmatter.description: ecommerce consultant at [ecomloop](https://ecomloop.com). I enjoy using technology to make everyday lives incrementally better. Nantucket-native. Boston College alum. San Francisco Bay Area since 2004.
